item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "I wondered if that was how forgiveness budded; not with the fanfare of epiphany, but with pain gathering its things, packing up, and slipping away unannounced in the middle of the night." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "For age is opportunity no less Than youth itself, though in another dress, And as the evening twilight fades away The sky is filled with stars, invisible by day." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books ..is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero
